Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Kansas \Kan"sas\, prop. n. A state of the central United States, bordering the Mississippi River to the west. [PJC]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Kansas \Kan"sas\, prop. n. pl. (Ethnol.) A tribe of Indians allied to the Winnebagoes and Osages. They formerly inhabited the region which is now the State of Kansas, but were removed to the Indian Territory. [1913 Webster]

Kansas n 1: a state in midwestern United States [syn: {Sunflower State}, {KS}] 2: a member of the Siouan people of the Kansas river valley in Kansas [syn: {Kansa}] 3: a river in northeastern Kansas; flows eastward to become a tributary of the Missouri River [syn: {Kansas River}, {Kaw River}] 4: the Dhegiha dialect spoken by the Kansa people [syn: {Kansa}]
